Title: Gail eyes start of year-round Dabhol LNG operations from 2025
Description: India's state-owned Gail plans to operate its 5 mtpa Dabhol LNG terminal in Maharashtra state on the country's west coast at full capacity from 2025, following the completion of the construction of a breakwater facility after the end of India’s monsoon season.
Author: JS

Title: OMV secures additional gas pipeline capacities until 2029
Description: Austria’s state-owned OMV has secured 51 TWh (5.2 billion m3) of additional pipeline gas capacity from 2026 until 2029, as it moves to increase the use of pipelines from Germany for gas imports while further diversifying away from its reliance on Russia.
Author: JS

Title: Chhara LNG terminal commissioning pushed to November-December
Description: State-owned Hindustan Petroleum Corp. expects to commission its 5 mtpa Chhara LNG terminal in the Gir-Somnath district of Gujarat before the year-end, following a false start in April. Once the terminal is online, it plans to offer terminal capacity for lease.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s end-July LNG stocks dip amid hotter weather
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities dipped for the week ending Jul. 28 after rising a week earlier above the five-year average for July.
Author: CK
